column4: Hello, I had Ubuntu 7.10 64bit for a month and all  worked fine. Then I reinstalled it (still Ubuntu 7.10 64bit, same live cd install) and now I cant get rid of one big issue: any application i execute will take forever to start. I am talking 10 secs for Nautilus, 16 secs for Firefox). The CPU load and the RAM usage are very low, i cant figure out what is wrong. I installed again to see if there had been some mistake while installing, bu
you probably have a bad /etc/hosts , put a copy on http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
ok thanks a lot! I will
here it is, thank you http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/57031/
edit /etc/hosts , so it's the same (without the .@liberolight)
that looks like something that has to do with the Internet connection, does that affect Nautilus and Firefox and all of the other apps?
did you say  lorenzo.laptop, or lorenzo-laptop?
that's only used internally by ubuntu, it won't affect internet access
i am not sure, I'll check again
ctl-alt-f2 , log in there, do your work, then clt-alt-f7 to get back
it says gedit cant open display, and it suggests i enter gedit --help
do  ctl-alt-f2 , log in there, make sure that /etc/hostname has lorenzo-laptop in it, and /etc/hosts has the line 127.0.1.1  lorenzo-laptop. (use sudoedit ). Then reboot ( sudo reboot)
the /etc/hosts line shouldn't end with a period, that was a sentence ending period :)
ok, thank you very much, i will try that!
